channel.title: Need Help Recognizing Java
channel.description:
Ok so filanny someone told me that in order to get JDK working on my comp I need to get it recognized so far I have made in my user variables for owner this: CLASSPATH C:\Java\jdk1.6_03\bin
PATH C:\Java\jdk1.6_03\bin
is that all I have to do or do I do the same is system variables

item.title: Need Help Recognizing Java
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“reggiedx1, post:13, topic:162819”]now its just blank… [br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 05, 2007, 06:14:20 PM[/size][hr]i read the post u just did and i tryed that but when i did it, it shut off my comp and then i turned it on and it said

“Fatial Error Has been recoverd”
“send error report?”[/quote]

There are numerous errors that have nothing to do with my code. You could have a software error with windows or a problem with your computer. You probably want to get that checked.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Recognizing Java
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

The variables are unneeded with the above batch code. The code just iterates through all the jdk directories in the Java folder until it finds one and then it uses the java compiler from that jdk. I would advise you uninstall all older version of the jdk before using it.

Read full topic

kk thanks im tryin git right now…and yes i have thos veribles

item.title: Need Help Recognizing Java
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

By the way, you really should not set classpath, unless you are planning on using the command prompt/terminal.

reggiedx1:

i did all that but it still dosent work…im using taharocks compiler but it wont reconize java evn tho i did this…can u help me?

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
::							::
::	This Compiler is under no licenses and may	::
::	be distributed freely.				::
::							::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
"%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

The only time it would not work would be if you were running Windows Vista x64 edition and you were using the x86 version of the jdk.

Read full topic

item.description:

this is ur path=user varibles
C:\Java\jdk1.6_03\bin
and ur classpath=system varibles
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
